page.title: 03 Badgers
page.content: In Silverton we are very lucky to have a number of wild creatures in and around the village. One animal that is quite common is the badger. Mr Gooding has made a study of the local badgers and he told us all about them. He took us to look at a badgers' set. We saw five badgers' sets and three were in use at the time with about nine or ten badgers in them. The river Exe divdes our twelve survey squares roughly in half. On the Silverton side we think there are about ten sets in use at any one time. We would assume a similar number in the other half of our squares, making a total badger population of about twenty used sets. Some people want to kill badgers because they think they have T.B., and can give it to cattle.
